Description: Papyrus; Demotic legal text recto; names of witnesses verso.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Kharaba el-Kebir, Fayum, Philadelphia
Curator's comments: No acquisition details are recorded, apart from a comment in the registers 'incorporated into the collection after reassembly and repair'. According to Shore's remarks EA 10792 was 'identified among unaccessioned material .. in 1960', then conserved by Stanley Baker and then registered (see bibliography for EA 10792), and the same is presumably true of the group EA 10787-92.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (56224) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/56224)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bloom, brittle, fractured, loss Black ink Tabbed: silk Supported locally: white paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
